column4: ok best i can figure this HDD is not formated, or is formated to some obscure BS proprietary format so is there a way to format an unlabeled disk?
possibly a command line option?
i can't find any info on the format command, does anyone know the syntax, and if/how i can point it at a specific directory/disk?
the command is mkfs, read the manpage.  Or use gparted/parted if you need more guidance
thank you
I get "file too large while trying to determine filesystem size" the drive is 160GB
with which tool?
Do you have a gui on that computer, gparted is much easier to use
I believe there is a 'capabilities' (or similar) option somewhere in gparted, does it list labelling for your filesystem type?
Show Features perhaps? the whole thing is unallocated at the current time
ah, okay. Why dont you go ahead and make the filesystem, format it and worry about the label afterwards?
i only have the option to set the label, it grays out practically everything else
Have you created a parition yeT?
almost all my options are grayed out in gparted. there are currently no partitions, and no way i can see to make one
How did you run gparted?
I don't see a tools menu... I have GParted, Edit, View, Device, Partition, Help
How did you start gparted?
I started it from System>Administration i thought you meant a tools menu in GParted
Nope, Did it prompt you for the root password when you started it?
You could try doing it from the LiveCD or from a Gparted LiveCD, I've never had issues with either of those.
thanks for the help I will try from the live CD
good luck
